title: Aurelion sol rework is disgustingly horrible.
body:
i dont how it made it to live, and the person who thought this was a good idea probably needs employment somewhere else. 
do you know how hard it is to line up his W with an enemy with half a brain? now try do that within 3 seconds before you get but fucked. even if you do manage to hit it a few times you still lose damage because your most likely not going to hit all of your stars, maybe a good one or two maybe if i land my Q first but wait now thats harder to do without my passive movement speed, now i have to snail crawl my way to the enemies, cant even get a good engage on a team fight with building up a Q and walking it down lane because i dont have my passive E anymore, oh and if you're about to kill an enemies with you're W NOPE fuck you, your 3 seconds is over and your stars are retracting back. 
this shit needs to be reverted as soon as humanly possible, hot fix it for god sakes its THAT BAD.

Yes, because a person’s rank 100 percent determines the “worthiness” of their opinions.

You do realize that the vast majority of players reside in Gold and below, which technically makes their opinion worth more than yours, assuming you’re any higher than gold (I hope you are, for your sake, can’t tell because you’re obviously using a smurf account/alt to post)and considering he’s one of them, and their opinion isn’t an unpopular one.

You are the outlier here, and not only that, you’re an outlier in one of the least populated servers in the world. Just looking at pure numbers, that means your opinion on general balance for anyone below your rank is probably the least relevant and least useful thing to anyone at Riot with half a brain.

You are not any smarter, more knowledgeable, or better at balancing MOBA games than anyone else here, and you certainly aren’t any better than the ones who designed it.

Consider this a PSA for you and anyone else who thinks that having a shiny nice border around your picture in the loading screen entitles you to anything more than a few virtual rewards: it doesn’t. So go back to killing noobs on your alt to help your ladder anxiety and boost your fragile, fragile ego  while your main decays, because then at least you’d be doing something with even the slightest modicum of use.

They weren’t bringing up valid issues, they were trying to hurt their credibility by subtly ridiculing them for their rank. “Yeah Its not the champion”. Implying that it’s the player being bad, not the champion, therefore their opinion is invalid. Implying that a person’s opinion on champion balance when they are part of a majority of the playerbase (sub-gold) and the person discounting their opinion is presumably part of a smaller section of the playerbase is just silly, and I was pointing this out.

the credibility of their opinion is definitely directly tied into their proficiency with a character, and, again, 3cs/min on a character like asol? that's abhorrent

the majority of the game's opinion comes from players who aren't very good. the majority doesn't mean the opinion is more relevant, you're not right just because you're louder. if high elo players (the ranks in which asol has always been an extremely lethal pick when meta) think the change is good, it's probably good and outcry from players that are from a pool where asol has traditionally been picked almost never and the ones that do pick him aren't really good at the character? that outcry should mean less for the character's balance.

my opinion on the juggernaut class should hold more weight than someone who doesn't play juggernauts. someone who's better at playing juggernaut's opinion should be worth more than mine, because their understanding of the class is obviously deeper. this usually is going to coincide with rank, and, as i've said, the one giving the opinion of "asol is terrible" is from a pool where, traditionally, the players are the worst at asol and their opinion should be thrown to the side in favor of a pool of players where asol actually sees competence in his picks.

brings up a point again: if they were a good asol, they would climb with 1000+ games in silver. asol is a carry champion, if you don't climb and you say you're good as the character, you probably aren't.

You’re claiming that high-elo players know best, which is always a fallacy. High-elo players offer a unique perspective...one that matters very little to the majority of the playerbase. Giving a very small pool of players much more power and a louder voice than everyone else is, using your logic, just as bad as claiming low-mid elo players are more relevant, and makes you seem elitist and biased against those with a less-fancy virtual medal.

High-elo players usually only care about what affects the meta plat+. They don’t care about anything else, naturally, because they aren’t affected by any changes directed at what they consider to be the unwashed masses. Same goes for low-elo players. The difference is, there are more low-elo players, which means their opinions technically affect a larger part of the player-base than someone in high-elo.

Aurelion Sol may be played more in high elo, so maybe this specific example is an outlier in this regard, as high-elo opinions are more relevant in this specific context, but for nearly every other champion this isn’t the case, and one could still make the argument that riot is unfairly favoring one part of the playerbase over the other, as instead of making Sol more playable for everyone, they made him harder to use overall, forcing him into the awkward “high elo only” pidgeon-hole.

I mean, if you’re going to to play the game and the champ sub-optimally, I can point out that it’s probably not just the changes that makes him feel weak to the user.

Nothing wrong with being silver, per say, but if you die consistently 12 times per game, have no macro sense, throw your champion into the enemy without thinking why...it’s not the changes that are the issue.

the rework is fine. you have less lane control for more windows of opportunity when it matters. not like all the rune changes didn't fuck the character as much as possible or anything right

learn to adapt to the character now. he's less roam intensive and has windows to fuck with his opponent, and his trading is ridiculously good if you have a brain. ms boost every sub 5 seconds with rylais or glacial / phase rush? epic. difficult to use still, easier to win with.

personally i never saw the point of building up a q? you use that to zone off lanes when roaming and force them to be stunned or to run into your team. your w's cd is nonexistant at rank 5 with 10% ~ 20% cdr. your e is now strictly for roaming or approaching objectives.

Just played new Sol after having only played the old one once or twice. I like it. It's definitely more new player friendly.
